item.title: Fourth Post
item.author: Author
item.description:
Hello World, c++:

#include <iostream>
 
int main()
{
    std::cout << "Hello, world!" << std::endl;
    return 0;
}

Hello World, c#:

using System;
class Program
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Hello, world!");
    }
}

Hello World, go:

package main
 
import "fmt"
 
func main() {
   fmt.Println("Hello, world!")
}

Hello World, java:

public class HelloWorld {
   public static void main(String[] args) {
       System.out.println("Hello, world!");
   }
}

Hello World, ruby:

puts "Hello, world!"

item.title: Third Post
item.author: Author
item.description:
Title

Hello world in java:

public class HelloWorld {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello, World");
    }
}

And for python:

print("Hello, World!")

There should be some content so let's use classic placeholder...
